intro: Vangueria leucophloea, commonly known as the white phloem vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and often have a white or pale pink color. Vangueria leucophloea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
